channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How cutting Medicaid would affect long-term care and family caregivers
item.description: The federal program is the biggest source of money for long-term care for the elderly and disabled. Republican proposals to cut its budget could jeopa...

item.title: Ukrainians in the U.S. use connections and their art to support the war effort
item.description: Amid concerns over Trump's foreign policy and Russian influence, Ukrainians look for new ways to raise awareness.

item.title: Anxiety drugs found in rivers make salmon take more risks
item.description: New research suggests that pharmaceutical pollution can change the behavior of salmon in the wild.

item.title: In Sudan, hundreds killed in attacks on famine-hit displacement camps
item.description: Sudanese paramilitary group the Rapid Support Forces has claimed it has taken control of famine-hit Zamzam camp, after days of deadly fighting in the ...

item.title: Why Trump exempted electronics from tariffs. And, Meta's biggest trial begins today
item.description: Trump spared electronics from his sweeping tariffs. Here's why he wants to levy semiconductors next. And, the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust cas...

item.title: 'Death is everywhere': Sudan camp residents shelter from attacks
item.description: One person in Zamzam described things as "extremely catastrophic" after three days of assaults.

item.title: Man arrested after arson at Pa. Governor's Residence​
item.description: Cody Balmer will be charged with attempted homicide and more after intentionally setting a fire at the Pennsylvania Governor's Residence​, officials s...

item.title: Former NCAA woman of year among 6 dead in family plane crash in NY
item.description: Karenna Groff, a former MIT soccer player once named the NCAA woman of the year, was one of six people killed in a plane crash.

item.title: Helicopter tour company involved in fatal NYC crash shuts down, FAA says
item.description: New York Helicopter Tours, the company involved in the deadly crash on the Hudson River last week​, is shutting down its operations, the FAA said Sund...

item.title: Gaza medic missing since deadly attack being detained by Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: Asaad al-Nassasra has been missing since Israeli troops killed 15 other emergency workers in south Gaza three weeks ago.

item.title: Algeria to expel 12 French embassy officials
item.description: France said the move was in response to the indictment of three Algerians in Paris on Friday.

item.title: White Lotus' Aimee Lou Wood calls SNL parody 'mean and unfunny'
item.description: The White Lotus star said a sketch that impersonated her using prosthetic teeth "punched down" on her.

item.title: South Africa re-opens inquest into Nobel laureate's death
item.description: The official ruling - that Albert Luthuli died in an accident in 1967, has long been queried by his family.

item.title: Ban on music glorifying cartels sparks violence, chaos at concert
item.description: Luis R. Conriquez and his band were forced to flee the stage after saying he had been banned by the government from singing "narcocorridos" music.

item.title: What to know about Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro and the alleged arson at his official residence
item.description: A man is facing charges after authorities say he broke into the Pennsylvania governor’s mansion in the middle of the night, set a fire that left signi...

item.title: Russian missiles hit kill 34 in Ukraine amid Palm Sunday celebrations
item.description: The strikes from two Russian ballistic missiles killed at least 34 people, including two children, and wounded about 117 in the northeastern Ukrainian...

item.title: FAA says company whose sightseeing chopper crashed, killing 6, is ceasing operations immediately
The dead in upstate New York plane crash included 2022 NCAA woman of the year and family members
